DataElement.preferredName: Patient Breast Malignant Neoplasm Other Clinical Trial Participant Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the participation of a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care for breast cancer on another research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Breast Malignant Neoplasm Other Clinical Trial Participant
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the participation of a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care for breast cancer on another research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Breast Malignant Neoplasm Other Clinical Trial Participant
Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
Someone who takes part in an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
